definition: my late father/my ancestors/the late emperor
former kings/former emperors/in Confucian writing, refers esp. to the sage rulers Yao 堯|尧[Yao2], Shun 舜[Shun4], Yu 禹[Yu3], Tang 湯|汤[Tang1] and the kings of Zhou
the lord of Lu (who declined to employ Confucius)
I (first person pronoun used by royalty or nobility)
Duke Wen of Jin (697-628 BC, reigned 636-628 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
the (rightful) emperor/"Son of Heaven" (traditional English translation)
Zi Chan (?-522 BC), statesman and philosopher during the Spring and Autumn period
King Cheng of Zhou (1055-1021 BC), reigned 1042-1021 BC as the 2nd king of Western Zhou 西周[Xi1 Zhou1], son of King Wu of Zhou 周武王[Zhou1 Wu3 wang2]
King Xuan, eleventh King of Zhou, reigned (828-782 BC)
Great Ancestor (posthumous title, e.g. for the founder of a dynasty)
the most senior minister of many kingdoms or dynasties (with varying roles)/prime minister
